name: The Aurelia Blog - Page 12
description: The official blog of the Aurelia project and Core Team.

posts.name: Blog Address Change
posts.description: Currently our blog is located at blog.durandal.io. That's a bit odd considering all the content here is directly related to Aurelia. So, we'll be moving the blog to blog.aurelia.io this coming week. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause you. Thanks!

posts.name: Aurelia Validation Alpha 2
posts.description: We're excited to announce the release of aurelia-validation alpha 2! This release is a complete overhaul of the validation system.

posts.name: Aurelia i18n Update and CLI Tutorial
posts.description: Today, Core Team Member Vildan Softic gives us an update on Aurelia's i18n library and explains how to configure it for an Aurelia CLI project as well as TypeScript. Take it away Vildan...

posts.name: Built With Aurelia
posts.description: We've had a lot of requests from those interested in Aurelia to hear about and see apps, plugins and components built with Aurelia. This week, one of our Core Team authors and creators, Dwayne Charrington, has something cool to share...

posts.name: Aurelia Training Recordings
posts.description: Since we announced the Aurelia Virtual Training [https://www.picatic.com/modern-javascript-and-aurelia] opportunity we've received tons of responses. The biggest request we've had is the community's desire to gain access to recordings of the trainings after the event. In response to this, we're going to make recordings of the training available to each ticket purchaser.

posts.name: Aurelia Virtual Training is Coming Up!
posts.description: If you are interested in getting training in either Modern JavaScript or Aurelia, there's a fantastic opportunity coming up [https://www.picatic.com/modern-javascript-and-aurelia].

posts.name: Releases - August 3, 2016
posts.description: Even though we released Aurelia 1.0 last week, we're not slowing down. We're continuing to make fixes and enhancements. In order to keep the community informed, we'll make sure to post these updates here each week as needed.
